titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corporation rate schedule notices 1978.134
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:35 +0000.

did.unittitle: 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corporation rate schedule notices

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corp. (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: One notice listing rate schedules of the 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corporation, and one notice announcing rate schedule changes. Dated 1966. The 69th Street Brookyn Ferry Corporation operated a ferry between the Bay Ridge neighborhood of Brooklyn and Staten Island. Service on the 69th Street ferry had begun in 1912 and continued under various operators until 1964, when the 69th Street ferry was terminated.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corporation rate schedule notices, 1978.134, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The 69th Street Brookyn Ferry Corporation operated a ferry between the Bay Ridge neighborhood of Brooklyn and Staten Island. Service on the 69th Street ferry had begun in 1912 and continued under various operators until 1964, when the 69th Street ferry was terminated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One notice listing rate schedules of the 69th Street Brooklyn Ferry Corporation, and one notice announcing rate schedule changes. Dated 1966.
